title: Day 1294
content:
# Day 1294

Software is cool. I love to see algorithms improving so quickly, it feels tangible. What I have been able to make with Sora 2 and [Suno](https://suno.com/invite/@conorchepenik) would've required a Hollywood studio and a record label just five years ago. Now it's me in boxers with a laptop, accidentally competing with Disney. Well not yet, but at this rate very soon.

Bitcoin did the same thing for money. It made value itself programmable and incorruptible. For the first time, we can own digital truth, not through trust, but through math. Central banks are still printing PDFs about "blockchain initiatives" while teenagers run lightning nodes. AI and Bitcoin are parallel revolutions: one giving form to incredible new thoughts, the other giving real weight to truth. Both are making institutional middlemen sweat through their suits.

Every leap in software brings us closer to self-sovereignty. Intelligence, energy, and value flow freely between people without permission slips. The old guard keeps trying to regulate code like it's a fax machine. Bad actors will try to exploit these systems, sure, but they're competing against the human spirit. They won't win.

Watching these systems evolve side by side feels like witnessing the architecture of a freer civilization being coded in real time, while legacy institutions hold emergency meetings about "disruption" in conference rooms that still have landlines.

The future is being built by people who will not ask for permission to do so. The past is being defended by people who can't reset their email passwords.

Bullish on our future!

10/6/25

Conor Jay Chepenik
